title: howto:twitter
body:
"Twitter":[https://twitter.com] is where a growing number of Japanese artists publish their works. It's one of the main sources of images on Danbooru.

[b]Note:[/b] Japanese artists may refer to Twitter using the half-width ﾋ character, since it resembles how Twitter's logo used to look.

h4. Uploading

To upload from Twitter, paste a link to the tweet on the "upload page":[/uploads/new], like this:

* https://danbooru.donmai.us/uploads/new?url=https://twitter.com/weirdlilguys/status/1755223245614150080

Don't paste a direct link to the image, like this:

* https://danbooru.donmai.us/uploads/new?url=https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GFvOPQpW0AAR0A4.jpg

If you paste a direct link to the image, then Danbooru won't be able to find which tweet it belongs to, and won't be able to pull the artist, tags, and commentary.

h4. Image quality

Since December 11th, 2019, Twitter won't compress or downscale images unless the image is bigger than 4096x4096, more than 5MB large, or it has [[exif rotation]] or very inefficient compression ("[1]":[https://twitter.com/NolanOBrien/status/1204557498990002176], "[2]":[https://twitter.com/NolanOBrien/status/1204842518208057344]).

This means that Twitter uploads usually have the same quality as Pixiv uploads.

Images posted before December 11th, 2019 were always compressed or downscaled (except for PNG with alpha channel), so Twitter images from this time period were generally lower quality than Pixiv images.

h4. Artists

When making an artist entry, add both the username and user ID profile URLs, like this:

* http://twitter.com/GK0322
* http://twitter.com/intent/user?user_id=12345678

Danbooru will usually fill in both URLs automatically when making a new artist entry. If if doesn't, then you can use https://tweeterid.com to determine a user's Twitter ID, or use the following bookmarklet:

[expand=Bookmarklet to show ID]
[code]
javascript:(() => {prompt('Twitter ID', `https://twitter.com/intent/user?user_id=${JSON.parse(document.querySelector(%27script[data-testid=%22UserProfileSchema-test%22]%27)?.textContent)?.author?.identifier}`)})()
[/code]
[/expand]

See [[howto:artist]] for more information about artist entries.

h4. See also

* [[bad twitter id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]
* [[twitter sample]]

title: katy_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Katy[/b], known as [b]Kaede[/b] in Japan, is a Gym Leader of Cortondo's Gym from [[pokemon sv|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]]. Besides being a Gym Leader, Katy runs a bakery named Patisserie Soapberry, having been trained in the art of baking under the wing of [[kofu (pokemon)|Kofu]]. 

Katy specializes in Bug-type Pokémon. The final Pokémon she uses in battle is a [[terastallization|Terastallized]] [[Teddiursa]].

h4. Official art

* !post #7368671: [[Katy (pokemon)|Default]]

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Katy":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Katy]

body:

Starfish are invertebrates and not fish despite having "fish" in its name.

Wooden lifeless versions are commonly seen in the company of [[Ibuki Fuuko]].

title: jingwei_(bird)
body:
A recurring character across the [[Honkai (series)|]] franchise.

The bird that commonly appears alongside [[Fu Hua]] and the [[Fu Hua (Herrscher of Sentience)|Herrscher of Sentience]] in [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] and [[Sushang (Honkai: Star Rail)|Sushang]] in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

[b]In Honkai Impact 3rd[/b], it mostly shows up in events and can appear in four different ways:

* !post #4892797: Naked, completely white, with black eyes and red tips; associated with Fu Hua
* !post #4666784: Clothed with red eyes, can sometimes appear with black glasses, associated with the Herrscher of Sentience
* !post #4799112: Naked, completely white, with one eye covered and green tips; associated with the [[Fu Hua (Azure Empyrea)|Azure Empyrea]]
* !post #6640267: The [[Fu Hua (Phoenix)|Celestial Phoenix]]

[b]In Honkai: Star Rail[/b], the bird appears in two forms:

* !post #8125350: Sushang's Ultimate and on her phone case (pictured)
* !post #8125352: Qinqque's bird motif and hair ornament

Other names include:
* Chic
* Chic Phoenix
* Dark Chic Phoenix (Herrscher of Sentience's version only)
* Pyo
* Jingwei Bird
* Chicken
* Phoenix (used by Sushang in HSR)

Use this tag for real animals that exist or have existed on earth. 

Please use [[monster]] or [[creature]] for fictional or mythical animals, such as [[griffin]]s, [[cabbit]]s, or [[jackalope]]s.

title: yokoyama_chika
body:
[[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]] character.

Chika has a love of magical girls and boundless energy. She finds the stage theatrics and the costumes of idols similarly flashy and cute, and wishes to experience the magic for herself. Chika owns a wide variety of toys based on the Trinkets from other magical girl shows. In fact, everything from her toys to her first Idol outfit to her overall appearance is evocative of Sailor Moon-like shows. She may make mistakes occasionally, but she responds to them all with a smile.

h4. External links

* "Project-iM@S Wiki: Chika Yokoyama":https://www.project-imas.wiki/Chika_Yokoyama

title: onyankopon_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Given etmyology is Akan (Twi): "Supreme being, God". The name of an aspect of the Akan religion's supreme deity, "Nyame":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nyankapon-Nyame-Odomankoma].[/tn]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Eishin Flash (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Chariot d'Or, he is infamous for his name that, despite the given etmyology, it has a cutesy, cat-like ring to it. Then again, it was given to him with the acknowledgement of that disparity and the effect it would have.

He is a bay horse with a stripe facial marking and a stocking on his right hind leg.

Aside for the name, he is still one of Eishin Flash's most succesful progeny (not that it means much, he has a single GIII victory), only Vela Azul (2022 Japan Cup) beats him in that respect.

title: gundam_hathaway's_flash
body:
A novel series in the UC [[Gundam]] timeline. Set in [b]Universal Century 105[/b], 12 years after the events of [[Char's Counterattack]], the novels follow the exploits of [[Mafti Nabiyu Erin]] [spoiler]aka [[Hathaway Noa]][/spoiler], as he leads a terrorist cell against the [[Earth Federation]].

The novels will be adapted into a trilogy of films, with the first one released in June 11, 2021 after being delayed due to COVID-19. Previous to the adaptation's announcement, the original source material made appearances in multiple Gundam crossover games, and had it's SRW debut in [[Super Robot Wars V]].

title: takani_yoshiyuki
body:
[b]Takani Yoshiyuki[/b] (高荷 義之, born December 18, 1935) is a legendary Japanese illustrator known for his paintings of [[realistic]], as well as fictional, [[military]] hardware. His illustrations have been used as packaging art for numerous resin kits and movie posters for several decades. 

Takani began his career by doing boxart for military [[aircraft]], [[tank]]s and [[battleship]] model kits in the 1950s and 1960s. Since then he has done art for several [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] shows from the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s. Among them [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]], [[Gundam]], [[Sentou Mecha Xabungle]], [[Macross]], [[Orguss]], [[Kikou-Kai Galient]], [[Transformers]], [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]] and many others. 

Since the late 80s he also created the [[box art]] of several action and military themed [[video game]]s. Takani was responsible for drawing the cover artwork for [i][[Metal Gear 2]]: Solid Snake[/i] and contributed to additional illustrations in the Japanese premium package editions of [i][[Metal Gear Solid]]: The Twin Snakes[/i] and [i][[Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater]]: Snake Eater[/i].

Takani's work and life has inspired the careers of [[tenjin_hidetaka|many notable Japanese realistic artists]] in the last decades.

h4. See also
* [[Takani Yoshiyuki (Style)]]

title: ultra_eye
body:
[[Ultraseven]]'s transformation item, which is a pair of red-trimmed glasses. Also known as the [b]Task-Mask[/b] in the English dub.

As [[Moroboshi Dan]], he can use the Ultra Eye to transform into his Ultra form. It is also prone to getting stolen by [[alien]] invaders, rendering him unable to transform without it, forcing him to call upon his Capsule Monsters.

His son, [[Ultraman Zero]], uses the [[Ultra Zero Eye]], which also functions similarly to his father's Ultra Eye.

title: cyberdemon
body:
A recurring [[demon]] from [[Doom (series)|DOOM]]. Known for its exceptional durability and very powerful arm-mounted rocket launcher.

h4. Variants
* [[DOOM 3]]'s Cyberdemon, the final boss of the main campaign. As with most enemies from the game, it received a different portryal, but functions the same as you'd expect.
* [[DOOM (2016)]]'s Cyberdemon has had a big makeover, and some more tricks up it's sleeves than the original.
* [[DOOM Eternal]]'s [i]Tyrant[/i], which bears greater similarity to the Cyberdemon from classic DOOM.
* [[Legacy of Rust]]'s [[Tyrant (legacy of rust)|]], a simple reskin and voice change from the original Cyberdemon- but with significantly decreased health.

title: myhouse.wad
body:
[b]"MyHouse":[https://www.doomworld.com/forum/topic/134292-myhousewad/].wad[/b] is a [[DOOM II]] tribute map by DoomWorld user, Veddge, to his recently deceased childhood friend, based upon a map said friend originally created of his own "house":[https://www.doomworld.com/forum/topic/134292-myhousewad/].

Requires the latest version of "GZDoom":[https://zdoom.org/index] and an official DOOM II IWAD.

[spoilers]In reality, "MyHouse":[https://www.doomworld.com/forum/topic/134292-myhousewad/].wad (or "MyHouse":[https://www.doomworld.com/forum/topic/134292-myhousewad/].pk3) is a surrealist and psychological horror experience, inspired by the novel [i]"House of Leaves":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Leaves][/i]. It very quickly received public attention due to its extremely well-done use of mapping features and ambiguous, yet melancholic implied story. It features looping versions of the "house":[https://www.doomworld.com/forum/topic/134292-myhousewad/], with slightly different features, some being geometrically/spatially impossible, seamless transitions to other locations, such as an abstract, brutalist, [[backrooms (creepypasta)|]]-like maze, an [[airport]], a liminal [[bathhouse]], and many more, all with the same architectural and furniture layout of the original "house":[https://www.doomworld.com/forum/topic/134292-myhousewad/]. Associated with the DoomWorld post is a journal of Veddge's mapping progress, coping with the loss, and as is built up throughout, his deteriorating mental health in lieu of resurgent bad memories and almost supernatural events through unceasing nightmares, contributing to the "unfiction" and immersion.[/spoilers]

The DoomWorld post may be found "here":[https://www.doomworld.com/forum/topic/134292-myhousewad/]. The actual map file is "MyHouse":[https://www.doomworld.com/forum/topic/134292-myhousewad/].pk3. The name ""MyHouse":[https://www.doomworld.com/forum/topic/134292-myhousewad/].[i]wad[/i]" is a reference to a mapping trend dating back to the 90's; it was common for people to build Doom maps based on their own "houses":[https://www.doomworld.com/forum/topic/134292-myhousewad/]", and these became known generically as ""myhouse":[https://www.doomworld.com/forum/topic/134292-myhousewad/].wad" maps.

h4. See also
* [[DOOM II]]

title: organization_xiii
body:
(じゅうさんきかん, [i]Juusan Kikan[/i])

Antagonistic group of Nobodies (persons without hearts) from the [[KINGDOM HEARTS]] action-RPG series.

Members retain their sense of self, and many are shown to command generic and specific types of lesser Nobodies. All members routinely wear dark, hooded coats; visual distinctions are made by their dramatized physical features and unique weapons. Coincidentally, each member has an affiliation with some element.

h4. Members

* I - [[Xemnas]], the Superior
** [[white hair]], [[dark skin]]
** Element: nothingness (nil)
** Weapon: ethereal blades

* II - [[Xigbar]], the Freeshooter
** [[grey hair]], [[ponytail]], [[eyepatch]]
** Element: space
** Weapon: arrowguns

* III - [[Xaldin]], the Whirlwind Lancer
** long, black dreadlocks, long sideburns
** Element: [[wind]]
** Weapon: six [[lance]]s

* IV - [[Vexen]], the Chilly Academic
** straight, blond hair, thin eyes
** Element: [[ice]]
** Weapon: [[shield]]

* V - [[Lexaeus]], the Silent Hero
** short, wirey hair, thick jaw
** Element: earth
** Weapon: [[tomahawk|axe sword]]

* VI - [[Zexion]], the Cloaked Schemer
** short, silver hair covering one eye
** Element: illusion
** Weapon: [[book|lexicon]]

* VII - [[saix|Saïx]], the Luna Diviner
** raked, blue hair, X-shaped facial [[scar]]
** Element: [[moon]]
** Weapon: claymore

* VIII - [[Axel (Kingdom Hearts)|]], the Flurry of Dancing Flames
** spiky, red hair, tear-shaped marks beneath eyes
** Element: [[fire]]
** Weapon: two [[chakram]]s

* IX - [[Demyx]], the Melodious Nocturne
** upturned, mullet-style blond hair
** Element: [[water]]
** Weapon: [[sitar]]

* X - [[Luxord]], the Gambler of Fate
** short, blond hair, mustache-goatee combo
** Element: luck
** Weapon: [[playing card|cards]]

* XI - [[Marluxia]], the Graceful Assassin
** feathered, pink hair
** Element: [[flower]]
** Weapon: [[scythe]]

* XII - [[Larxene]], the Savage Nymph
** short, blond hair with two antenna-like strands
** Element: [[lightning]]
** Weapon: [[knife|knive]]s

* XIII - [[Roxas]], Key of Destiny
** short, flipped blond hair, blue eyes
** Element: [[light]]
** Weapon: [[Keyblade]]

* XIV - [[Xion (Kingdom Hearts)|]]
** short, black hair, blue eyes
** Element: [[light]]
** Weapon: [[Keyblade]]

This tag should not be applied to any [[Xehanort]] who is not [[Xemnas]]. While [[Riku (kingdom hearts)|]] and [[mickey_mouse|King Mickey]] have worn the Organization's coat, they are not part of the group. [[Master_of_Masters|Master of Masters]] and [[luxu_(kingdom_hearts)|Luxu]] are also exempt.

title: final_fantasy_xiv
body:
Second [[Final Fantasy]] MMORPG by [[Square Enix]].

Initially a commercial and critical failure, the world of Final Fantasy XIV was temporarily shut down in an event known as the Seventh Umbral Calamity before being rebooted and relaunched as [i]Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn[/i], which takes place five years after. Since then, the game has received major critical acclaim both as an entry in the Final Fantasy series and an MMORPG, and has received five expansions. In Feburary 2022 [[Square Enix|SE Creative Studio III]] outlined plans for another 10 years of service.

h4. Playable Races

* [[Hyur]] ([[Hume]] equivalent)
* [[Elezen]] ([[Elvaan]] equivalent)

title: 2023_titan_submersible_incident
body:
On June 18, 2023, the [[titan (submersible)|Titan]], a [[submarine]] operated by OceanGate, sunk after suffered from decompression damage 740 kilometers off the coast of Newfoundland, Canada, during the sightseeing trip to the wreck of the [[RMS Titanic]]. All 5 people onboard, including OceanGate's CEO Stockton Rush, have been declared dead.

Subsequent investigations revealed the vessel was practically doomed from the start, due to poor design and ignorance by Stockton Rush, including him firing an expert for telling him his vessel was not seaworthy. This, combined with a viral photograph of the [[Logitech]] [[game controller]] that were being used to control the sub, led to various [[meme]]s deriding OceanGate and Rush.

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Titan_submersible_incident]

title: shimohara_sadako
body:
Shimohara Sadako (下原定子?) is a Witch of the [[502nd Joint Fighter Wing]], originating from [[Fuso (strike witches)|]] and affiliated with the Fuso Imperial Navy. Her familiar is the Japanese hare.

Warm, nurturing, and tirelessly helpful around the barracks, Shimohara acts as something of a mother figure in the 502nd, although her fondness for cute things (which includes some of her squadmates) and propensity for hugging has led to a "creepy old man" aspect of some portrayals.

She is both a talented and passionate cook, especially with regards to Fuso cuisine, for which Flying Officer [[Kanno Naoe|Kanno]] is especially grateful, although its led to a fondness for Fuso cuisine amongst the entire squad. Her specialties are nikujaga and miso soup and she tries to get supplies from Fuso to prepare them whenever there is an opportunity to. Also due having once set her sights on literature, she cherishes the Fuso culture and attempts to propagate it in the 502nd Joint Fighter Wing whenever she can.

Shimohara is based on Japanese flying ace Uehara Sadao (上原定夫).

title: sakamoto_mio
body:
Sakamoto Mio (坂本美緒) is a character from [[Strike Witches]] originating from the [[Fuso (strike witches)|]] empire. Her familiar is the Doberman. The squadron leader, she brings together the group with a fatherly atmosphere. 

She has a [[black_hair|black]] [[ponytail]] and is often seen wearing a white naval uniform with a [[school swimsuit]] [[swimsuit_under_clothes|underneath]], as well as an eyepatch that helps regulate usage of her magic eye. She is a part of the [[501st Joint Fighter Wing]], with the role of Major. Her affiliation however is the 288th Fuso Air Force, along with [[Miyafuji Yoshika]].

Her first [[Striker Unit]] was a A6M3a type Zero with with blue stripes on the vertical stabilizer as well as a blue angled stripe that points downward at the front and upward at the back as it's identification stripes. Her second unit is based off of the [i]Kawanishi N1K-J [b]Shiden[/b] (Violet Lightning)[/i]) with a single white angled identification stripe after she started becoming unable to raise proper shields once she reached the age of 20. She also forged a new [[katana]] that she calls Reppumaru, that has the ability to redirect [[Neuroi]] energy beams back to the enemy.

Mio is based on Japanese flying ace [[Sakai Saburou]].

h4. Equipment

* [[machine gun|13mm type-99 machine gun]]
* [[katana|Reppumaru]]

title: inufusa_yuno
body:
[[World Witches Series]] character.

She is a Warrant Officer of the [[505th Joint Fighter Wing]] and is mostly seen with [[Grete M. Gollob|Grete M. Gollob]] and [[Constantia Cantacuzino]]. Originates from [[Fuso (strike witches)|]].

She has short brown hair with an [[ahoge]], brown eyes, and wears [[bike shorts]]. She is based off of Oofusa Youjirou, her weapon is an MG34, and her familiar is the [[Akita Inu]].

title: mille-feuille
body:
A [[dessert]] made up of three layers of puff pastry, alternating with two layers of pastry cream, but sometimes [[whipped cream]] or [[jam]] are substituted. The top pastry layer is dusted with confectioner's sugar, and sometimes cocoa, pastry crumbs, or pulverized seeds (e.g. roasted almonds). Alternatively the top is glazed with icing or fondant in alternating white (icing) and brown (chocolate) stripes, and combed.

"Mille-foglie" in italian

title: kirby's_return_to_dream_land
body:
The second [[Kirby (series)|]] game released for the Nintendo [[Wii]] after [[Kirby's Epic Yarn]].

This game returns to the traditional game mechanics the franchise is known for (hence the American name). The main attraction here is the ability for three additional players to jump in at any time to make the game a co-op quest. It would later be remade for the Nintendo Switch, with visual upgrades and new features.

It also has a remake on the [[Nintendo Switch]], titled [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe]].

title: fender_jazzmaster
body:
Solid-body [[electric guitar]] first introduced by [[fender_musical_instruments_corporation|Fender]] in 1958, preceding its visually similar sibling the [[Fender Jaguar]] by four years. Much to the irony of the company's initial marketing towards jazz musicians as evidenced by its name, the Jazzmaster instead gained success within surf rock musicians. One of its most relevant roles came in the late 80's and early 90's with the shoegaze movement led primarily by My Bloody Valentine.

Characters that mainly play Jazzmasters include [[Hisako_(angel_beats!)|]] from [[Angel Beats!]].

Key visual differences from the [[Fender Jaguar]] include:

* Larger pickups.
* A longer-scale neck.
* A simpler switch circuit system, the biggest visual factor being that the controls aren't recovered with chrome around them.

h4. See also

* [[Fender Stratocaster]]
* [[Fender Telecaster]]
* [[Fender Mustang]]
* [[Fender Jaguar]]
* [[Gibson Les Paul]]
* [[Fender Jazzmaster]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: eyvel
body:
Playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Thracia 776]]. Known as the "Mistress of Fianna," she acts as the leader of the Fianna Freeblades and is [[Mareeta (Fire Emblem)|]]'s adoptive mother.

[spoilers]Her true identity is [[Brigid (Fire Emblem)|]], a character from [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]]'s First Generation, after losing her memories. She eventually regains her memory at the end of the game.[/spoilers]

title: perverted_nobita_(meme)
body:
A running gag from the [[Doraemon]] series which involves [[Nobi Nobita]] using various future gadgets borrowed from his friend [[Doraemon (Character)|]] in an attempt to impress his crush [[Minamoto Shizuka]]. Nobita would often end up humiliating Shizuka by exposing her [[nude]] body or her [[panties]], accidentally or not. This often resulted in Shizuka uttering the phase [i]"You're a [[pervert]], Nobita!"[/i]

A similar gag stipulated that whenever Shizuka attempts to take a [[bathing|bath]] or shower, no matter where, when, or how, Nobita will invariably be involved in some way.  For example, if she is at home, Nobita will use Doraemon's "[[Anywhere Door]]" to walk in on her.  Nobita walking in on her in the bath is another common plot, especially if he is using some form of new gadget.

This has become a plot point throughout the series' multi-decade run; in at least one instance she needed to find Nobita (who was lost). To do so, she went skinny dipping -- within minutes, Nobita ended up nearby by coincidence.
other_names: お風呂のしずかちゃん

title: moonlight_greatsword
body:
Recurring legendary weapon in [[FromSoftware]] games, first appearing in [[King's Field]]. It is a [[greatsword]] that [[glowing weapon|glows]] with otherworldly green (sometimes blue) light, and can launch projectiles when swung.

* [[Armored Core]] has the "LS-99-MOONLIGHT" (among other names).
* [[Demon's Souls]] has the "Large Sword of Moonlight".
* [[Dark Souls (series)|]] has the "Moonlight Greatsword", associated with [[Seath the Scaleless]].
** A replica called the "Bluemoon Greatsword" also exists in [[Dark Souls II|II]].
* [[Bloodborne]] has "Holy Moonlight Sword", wielded by [[Ludwig the Accursed]]. There is also a replica, "[[Ludwig's Holy Blade]]".
* [[Elden Ring]] has the "Dark Moon Greatsword", bestowed by [[Ranni the Witch]] at the end of her questline.

title: overskirt
body:
A [[skirt]] that is intended to be worn on top of another [[skirt]] or [[pants]], and that often has an open front.

Overskirt and [[showgirl skirt]] are mutually exclusive.

h4. See also

* [[high-low skirt]]
* [[half-skirt]]
* [[train (clothing)]]
* [[layered skirt]]

title: showgirl_skirt
body:
A [[skirt]] or [[dress]] that only covers the sides and rear, but leaves the front open. Usually worn with something like a [[leotard]] or swimsuit bottom.

If the skirt isn't stand alone, but is worn over another skirt, shorts or pants, it's an [[overskirt]] instead. Overskirt and showgirl skirt are [i]mutually exclusive[/i].

If the fabric also covers the front like a regular skirt, use [[high-low skirt]] instead.

h4. Examples

* [[train (clothing)]]

title: newspaper
body:
A scheduled publication containing [[news]] of current events, informative articles, diverse features, editorials, and advertising. It usually is printed on relatively inexpensive, low-grade paper such as newsprint.

One of these is the [[Bunbunmaru]] newspaper from the [[Touhou]] series.

title: work_boots
body:
[[Boots]] usually made of [[brown footwear|brown]] or [[black footwear|black]] [[leather]] with thicker rubber treads, meant for workers in [[factory|factories]], on [[construction site]]s, or similar worksites. They often have steel-lined toes to prevent a worker's foot from getting crushed. They are typically not as high as [[knee boots]] or [[thigh boots]].

title: warioware
body:
[b]Made in Wario[/b] (Japanese), [b]WarioWare[/b] (English)

A "microgame" collection series by [[Nintendo]]. It has seen releases on the [[Game Boy Advance]] (inc. a tilt-sensor game), [[GameCube]], [[Nintendo DS]] & [[nintendo_dsi|DSi]], [[Wii]], [[Wii U]], [[Nintendo 3DS]], and [[nintendo switch|Switch]]. The games take place in and around 'Diamond City'.

title: mega_man_(character)
body:
Known as [b]Rockman[/b] in Japan, he is the main titular protagonist of the [[Mega man (classic)|original Mega Man ]] series, first debuting in the [[mega man 1|game of the same name]] in 1987. He was given the name Rock (Mega) by his creator, [[dr. Light (mega man)|Doctor Thomas Light]], creating a pun with the name of his sister [[Roll (mega man)|]], but he was dubbed "Mega Man" after being modified into a super fighting robot.

title: saruyume
body: An infamous Japanese urban legend from [[2channel]]. This story is a dream the narrator has where they’re sitting on a mostly empty train, but the stations are unusual names like "minced meat" or "eye-gouging" which is what happens to the unfortunate passengers behind them... and they're next. The narrator usually wakes up by this time but receives a warning that the next time they have the dream would be the last.

title: wandenreich_uniform
body:
Uniform worn by the [[wandenreich]] in [[Bleach]] as well as [[Bleach: Sennen Kessen-hen]].

The base form of the uniform consists of a [[trench coat]], straight [[pants]], [[boots]], a [[cloak]] and a [[military hat]] all in white. The members of the [[Sternritter]] wear customised versions that vary greatly in design but mostly retain the white colour scheme.

title: muscular_uke
body:
A [[muscular male]] character who is submissive towards his smaller partner, either during [[sex]] or other scenarios.

Use this tag only when there's a noticeable [[size difference]] between the characters. In other words, this tag is for the fetish where expectations are subverted and the bigger character is submissive instead of dominant.

Additionally, this tag should not be used for [[hetero]]. For hetero depictions with a submissive male partner, use [[assertive female]].

title: agano_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Agano[/i], the name ship of her class. 
Character design by [[Hecha (01964237)|]], voiced by [[Shiraishi Haruka (voice Actor)|]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied by a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]] to a long [[ponytail]], with [[red eyes]]. She also wears a mix of traditional [[Japanese clothes]] (with prominent [[long sleeves]]), [[pantyhose]], and a [[black skirt]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of two 15.2 cm twin gun mounts and two 61 cm quadruple [[torpedo tubes]], one gun and torpedo mount on each side but her torpedoes are attached to her waist.

title: zack_fair
body:
A pivotal character in the backstory of [i][[Final Fantasy VII]][/i], referred to by other characters and seen numerous times in flashbacks. A member of SOLDIER, mentored by [[Angeal Hewley]], friend of [[Cloud Strife]], and romantic interest of [[Aerith Gainsborough]]. 

[spoilers]Being killed mere days before the chronological start of the game, in some ways he is the hero/protagonist [i]in absentia[/i] of FFVII. His death prompts Cloud to step into the void he leaves behind, in the process creating a false persona based on Zack to a large degree.[/spoilers] He finally gets his time in the spotlight in [i][[Crisis Core Final Fantasy VII]][/i]. [spoilers]And in the [i][[Final Fantasy VII Remake|FFVII Remake]] trilogy[/i] too.[/spoilers]

Voiced by Rick Gomez (CCFF7) and Caleb Pierce (FF7 Remake).

body:
A depiction of a character's body that flagrantly defies common sense, especially to comedic effect. This does not mean "[[bad anatomy]], but even worse!", nor does it cover conventional stylizations like [[chibi]]; it represents a conscious total disregard both for realistic anatomy and for the usual stylistic deviations therefrom.

title: acura_(brand)
body:
The luxury branch of [[Honda]], created in 1986 to sell their luxury and performance lineup overseas, most notably the iconic [[Honda NSX|NSX]]. Honda intended to bring the brand to the Japanese domestic market for the 2008 model year, but the plans were canceled due to the financial crisis. Has been limited to the North American market (US and Canada) for most of its existence.

As most of the cars are identical to their Honda counterparts in name and design aside from the branding, this tag should be used alongside the existing Honda vehicle tag when it has an Acura badge instead. Despite not having an international presence, the Acura brand has a strong motorsports history in the [[IMSA Sportscar Championship]], developing original [[le mans prototype|prototype-class]] cars for the purpose of competing in the championship's top class.

h4. Tagged Models
* [[Acura ARX-06]]
* [[Acura MDX]]
* [[Acura TLX]]

h4. See Also
* [[Type S: Chiaki's Journey]]

title: valorant
body:
A free-to-play hero-based first-person tactical shooter released by [[League of Legends]] developer Riot Games in 2020. The game was highly anticipated leading up to its release, since it is the first major PC game Riot has released since LoL launched in 2009. Valorant quickly shot up to the number one spot on [[Twitch.tv|Twitch]] streaming during its open beta, and has been compared to games such as [[Overwatch]] and [[Apex Legends]] for its roster of colorful heroes with distinct abilities, as well as [[Counter-Strike (series)|]] for its objective-based tac-shooter gameplay.

title: low_poly
body:
[[3D]] modelling that features very few polygons. Common in older and handheld game consoles such as the [[PlayStation 1|original PlayStation]] and [[Nintendo DS]] due to hardware limitations, some artists intentionally create works in this style as a homage to games from those systems.

Can overlap with [[pixel art]] due to the low-res textures applied to the models for authenticity.

On danbooru this tag applies to both 3D models and illustrations mimicking the style. To see 3D models only search {{low_poly 3d}}.

title: pop-up_headlights
body:
Headlights for [[car]]s that are hidden and flip or rotate into position when engaged. While they were often seen in [[sports car]]s in the 90s and earlier for the aerodynamic benefit while disengaged, they ultimately fell out of use due to advancements in fixed headlight design and stricter pedestrian safety requirements in certain regions.

The last major production car to feature this design trait was the [[chevrolet corvette c5|C5]] [[Chevrolet Corvette]]. Certain models with pop-ups (primarily Japanese cars from the 80s and 90s) are commonly modified so that the headlights only open a portion of the way. Pop-ups modified in this manner are often referred to as "sleepy eye" headlights.

This tag is only for posts that depict pop-up headlights in the engaged position.

h4. Examples
* !post #6660312: [[Mazda RX-7 FD|FD RX-7]] with pop-ups engaged
* !post #7217058: [[Mazda MX-5 NA|NA MX-5]] with pop-ups engaged and [[headlight beam]]s
* !post #6466322: [[Toyota Sprinter Trueno]] with a [[single pop-up headlight]] engaged
* !post #7941877: [[Nissan 180SX]] with sleepy eye pop-ups

title: t_(suzumiya_haruhi)
body:
A female character from the [[suzumiya_haruhi_no_yuuutsu|Haruhi series]] formally introduced in [i]The Intuition of Haruhi Suzumiya[/i] ([i]Suzumiya Haruhi no Chokkan[/i]).

T is a second year high schooler and foreign exchange student with [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]].  She came to North High during the Spring of [[Kyon]] and [[Suzumiya_Haruhi|Haruhi's]] second year of high school.  She is a member of the North High Mystery Research Club.

T is first introduced in the 2018 short story [i]Seven Wonders Overtime[/i], but was left unnamed because Kyon refused to introduce her or let her introduce herself.  In the 2020 story [i]Tsuruya's Challenge[/i], a new story a part of the [i]The Intuition of Haruhi Suzumiya[/i], she is formally identified with the nickname "T".

Kyon finds her annoying, especially because she refers to him by the nickname [i]Kyam[/i].

T's full name is introduced toward the end of [i]Tsuruya's Challenge[/i] and is [spoiler]Ottilie Adrastea Hohenstaufen-Baumgartner[/spoiler], which was shortened all the way down to "T" by her classmates. T is really close friends with [spoilers]Tsuruya and her family has close ties with the Tsuruya family business.[/spoiler]

title: sms_koenig_wilhelm
body:
A German ironclad frigate. Launched in 1868 and commissioned the following year, she served as its flagship during the Franco-Prussian War. In 1878, she accidentally rammed and sank the fellow ironclad Grosser Kurfürst. After being converted into an armoured cruiser in 1895 and later a training ship in 1904, she was eventually decommissioned and scrapped in 1921.
h4. External links
* "Wikipedia - SMS König Wilhelm":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SMS_K%C3%B6nig_Wilhelm]

title: banryuu_(warship)
body:
Originally a royal yacht named Emperor, it was seized by Tokugawa loyalists during the Boshin War and renamed Banryū. At the Battle of Hakodate in 1869, it sank the corvette Choyō but was in turn heavily damaged and had to be beached. It was eventually salvaged and passed through several owners before being scrapped in 1897.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Japanese warship Banryū":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_warship_Banry%C5%AB]

title: steve_trevor
body: General Steven Rockwell Trevor is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]], commonly in association with the superhero [[Wonder Woman]]. The character was created by William Moulton Marston and first appeared in All Star Comics #8 (October 21, 1941). Steve Trevor is a trusted friend, love interest, and partner of Wonder Woman who introduced her to "Man's World", and has served as her United Nations liaison. He is the first foreigner to have ever set foot on Themyscira and the first ambassador to open diplomatic relations with the Amazons.

title: e.g.o_(project_moon)
body:
E.G.O equipment (Short for Extermination of Geometrical Origin) is a recurring theme in [[Project Moon]] media. They can be used by characters in order to enhance their fighting prowess. They can take the form of weapons, clothes, items, or locations.

E.G.O may manifest in two manners:

* Extracted from abnormalities (taking a similar appearance from them)
* Manifested through intense feelings and determination

Notable E.G.O equipment includes [[Gebura (project moon)|]]'s Mimicry (E.G.O extracted from the abnormality [[Nothing There]]) and armour (Her own manifested E.G.O).

Prolonged usage of extracted E.G.O one is not fully qualified to use or with low levels of sanity can result in E.G.O corrosion. This results in the user transforming into a form similar to the abnormality the E.G.O was originally extracted from. [Spoiler]As shown with [[Heathcliff (project moon)|]], a personal E.G.O is also capable of corroding, but as it is personal to the user rather than extracted from an abnormality, it does not change appearance. Instead, it appears to herald Distortion.[/spoiler]
h4. See also

* [[Official alternate costume]]
* [[List of Project Moon characters]]

title: solemn_lament_(e.g.o)
body:
[[E.G.O (project moon)|]] extracted from [[Funeral of the Dead Butterflies]] abnormality in the [[Project Moon]] universe, first appearing in [[Lobotomy Corporation]].

* As a weapon, it appears as two [[handgun|handguns]], one white and one black, intended to be [[dual wielding|dual wielded]], with a [[butterfly print]] pattern of the [[white butterfly|opposite]] [[black butterfly|color]].
* As a suit, it appears as a [[black coat]] over a [[black vest|black]] [[waistcoat]] with [[lapels]] and [[black necktie]] and [[white shirt]].
* As a gift, it appears as a black [[coffin]] with a [[white butterfly|white]] [[butterfly print|butterfly printed]] on it.

Most images depicting this E.G.O set are in [[greyscale]], and [[Yi Sang (project moon)|]] is a prominent user with his [[Lobotomy Corporation (identity) (project moon)|Lobotomy Corporation Identity]] in [[Limbus Company]].

* !post #8107232: As depicted in [[Limbus Company]].

title: list_of_tagged_albums
body: This wiki page is currently a work in progress. A collection of all identified music albums on Danbooru, sorted alphabetically by the original artist's name, and sorted chronologically within each artist's section. For albums that have multiple cover variants, only the official primary variant is included in this list. Like with tagging conventions on Danbooru, Western artists are sorted firstname-lastname, while JP artists are vice-versa. Acts whose names start with the word "The" are listed alphabetically by the second word in their name. title: bonkers
body: A recurring mid-boss in the [[Kirby (series)|]] series. It is a [[hammer]]-wielding gorilla that wears [[jeans]] and has purple fur resembling a [[shirt]] and [[pompadour]]. Said hammer resembles that belonging to [[King Dedede]]. Once defeated, [[Kirby]] can inhale it to obtain the [[hammer kirby|Hammer]] [[copy ability]].

body: A recurring enemy in the [[Kirby (series)|]] series. It can detach the blade on its helmet and throw it like a boomerang. [[Kirby]] can inhale it to gain the [[cutter kirby|Cutter]] [[copy ability]].

title: blade_knight
body: A recurring enemy in the [[Kirby (series)|]] series. It resembles a green suit of armor and wields a [[sword]]. [[Kirby]] can inhale it to gain the [[sword kirby|Sword]] [[copy ability]].

title: chilly_(kirby)
body: A recurring enemy in the [[Kirby (series)|]] series. It resembles a snowman, with a blue cap on its head and a single [[jingle bell]] on its red [[collar]]. [[Kirby]] can inhale it to gain the [[Ice Kirby|Ice]] [[copy ability]].

title: giuseppe_garibaldi_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Italian light cruiser [i]Giuseppe Garibaldi[/i]. Character design by [[Ohisashiburi]], voiced by [[Toda Megumi]].

In-game, Garibaldi is shown with [[red eyes]] and [[blonde hair]] [[gradient hair|fading into red and black]] done into a pair of [[drill hair|small drill curls]] towards the front. Her bust is not as pronounced as her sister's, though it [[medium_breasts|isn't completely nonexistent.]] Also of note was the presence of a black [[tattoo]] along the side of her left breast until it was removed in her full [[rigging]] CG.

She was originally seen sitting next to her sister, [[duca_degli_abruzzi_(azur_lane)|Duca Degli Abruzzi]] in the latter's swimsuit skin before being made playable on July 28, 2022. In this new form, she gains a uniform and rig similar to her sister.

h4. Skins
* !post #5543707: Default
* !post #5543711: [[giuseppe_garibaldi_(noble_ivory_plumes)_(azur_lane)|Noble Ivory Plumes]]

title: duca_degli_abruzzi_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Italian cruiser [i]Luigi di Savoia Duca degli Abruzzi[/i]. Character design by [[Ohisashiburi]], voiced by [[Hirata Hiromi]].

She is depicted with [[red eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]], [[large breasts]] and a black and purple [[halo]]. Her most distinctive feature is her [[prosthetic arm|prosthetic right arm]]. Her outfit includes a [[red skirt]], long [[green cape]], [[black pantyhose]] and a [[black gloves|black]] [[single elbow glove]] on her left (non-prosthetic) hand.

title: victory_over_japan_day
body: The official surrendering ceremony of the Empire of [[Japan]] to the Allied powers held on board the [[United States Navy]] [[battleship]] [[USS Missouri (BB-63)]] moored on the Sagami bay, Japan. The event marked the official conclusion of [[World War II]].

title: uss_missouri_(bb-63)
body:
[b]USS Missouri (BB-63)[/b] is the third of the four [i]Iowa[/i]-class  [[battleship]] built for the [[United States Navy]].

She is best known as the site of [[victory_over_japan_day|the signing of the instrument of surrender]] of the Empire of [[Japan]] to mark the official end of [[World War II]] on September 2, 1945.

She is currently served as a museum ship at [[Pearl Harbor]], being moored directly across the [[USS Arizona Memorial]].

body: English: When the Morning Glory Falls Song by Pusu featuring [[Hatsune Miku]]. A human cover of the song with new instrumentals was made by the composer 4 years later for his band, [[TUYU (band)|]]. Whether to tag [[TUYU (band)|]] or [[Vocaloid]] depends on the represented character: The original Vocaloid version's character has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[aqua eyes]], wears a [[white shirt]] with [[blue shorts|blue]] [[shorts]] along with a [[blue sailor collar|blue]] [[sailor collar]] and a blue [[neck ribbon]]. While the TUYU version's character has [[very long hair|very long]] purple-ish [[black hair]] and [[pink eyes]], wears a [[long dress|long]] [[sleeveless]] [[white dress]] with a purple [[dress bow]], and a [[morning glory]] in her [[hair flower|hair]]. h4. External Links: * "YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ugs4oVUNZ-o] (Original) * "YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VP7FM1yyMpU] (TUYU Version)

title: yamato_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Yamato (Kancolle)|]]'s Kai Ni form (technically 2 forms, but outside of rigging, there is no difference between them) still maintains her base and Kai forms' [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] styled in a [[ponytail]] with [[sidelocks]] and [[hair intakes]], [[cherry blossoms|flower]] [[hair ornament|hair ornaments]], [[brown eyes]], and the same [[radar]] [[headgear]].

Clothing-wise, she sports an all-new attire, consisting of [[asymmetrical legwear|asymmetrical]] gradient boots (one reaching mid-thigh that retains the "Hirihoukenten" idiom written on it in kai form, one terminating just over the knee), a [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] high-waist skirt with no hip vents, a white long-sleeved shirt with prominent shoulder cutouts, and a long sleeveless [[white coat]]. Yamato's [[oil-paper umbrella|oriental umbrella]] has also seen some changes. Instead of being completely red like before her remodel, it is now white with a red crescent like pattern on one of its sides. She also has spare armor-piercing shells on her [[thigh strap|thigh straps]].

[[Rigging]]-wise, Yamato K2 has 2 forms, one that portrays her as a fast A-150 battleship with six 51cm guns in three twin turrets, and one that portrays her as slow aviation battleship with nine 51cm guns in three triple turrets. In terms of secondary battery, the A-150 fast battleship version uses 10 cm twin mounts while the BBV battleship version keeps her historical 12.7 cm twin mounts.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5416387: Aviation Battleship (BBV)
* !post #5416389: Fast Battleship (BB)

h4. See also

* [[Musashi Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]]

title: hayashi_sachi
body: A [i][[K-ON! College]][/i] character, she debuted after the April 2011 manga relaunch. A fellow student and light music club member at J Women's University, she and [[Akiyama Mio]] bonded quickly. Like Mio, she has many insecurities, including bust size and height, which she has a huge complex about. She is a member of OnNaGumi with [[Wada Akira]] and [[Yoshida Ayame]], who she has known for years, and plays bass guitar.

title: yoshida_ayame
body: A [i][[K-ON! College]][/i] character, she debuted after the April 2011 manga relaunch. A fellow student and light music club member at J Women's University, she has many similarities to [[Tainaka Ritsu]] and gets along well with her, and is very fashion conscious. She is a member of OnNaGumi with [[Wada Akira]] and [[Hayashi Sachi]], who she has known for years, and plays drums.

title: wada_akira
body: A [i][[K-ON! College]][/i] character, she debuted after the April 2011 manga relaunch. A fellow student and light music club member at J Women's University, she was initially considered a blunt, difficult character to deal with. However, she is shown to have a softer side and even she eventually became weak to Yui. She is a member of OnNaGumi with [[Yoshida Ayame]] and [[Hayashi Sachi]], who she has known for years, and plays guitar.

title: okuda_nao
body:
A [i][[K-ON! High School]][/i] character, she debuted after the April 2011 manga relaunch. An incoming freshman and light music club member at Sakuragaoka High School, she was initially known only as Okuda-san. 

Since she is too clumsy for physical activities, she joined as a last resort. However, as a [[dojikko]], she can't play instruments either. Because all she can do is study, she eventually became well-versed in music theory and learned how to use music creation software on the suggestion of [[Yamanaka Sawako]].

She is a member of [[Wakaba Girls (k-on!)|]] with [[Nakano Azusa]], [[Hirasawa Ui]], [[Suzuki Jun]], and [[Saitou Sumire]], and is the group's songwriter and producer.

title: saitou_sumire
body:
A [i][[K-ON! High School]][/i] character, she debuted after the April 2011 manga relaunch. An incoming freshman and light music club member at Sakuragaoka High School, she joins when she is caught trying to move [[Kotobuki Tsumugi]]'s tea sets out of the club room on her orders. 

Eventually, the nature of their relationship is revealed. The Saitou family has been serving the Kotobuki household for years, with Sumire serving as a maid and growing up with Mugi, who she regarded as her older sister. 

She is a member of [[Wakaba Girls (k-on!)|]] with [[Nakano Azusa]], [[Hirasawa Ui]], [[Suzuki Jun]], and [[Okuda Nao]], and plays drums.

title: hirasawa_ui
body:
A secondary character of [[K-On!]]. Voiced by [[Yonezawa Madoka]].
[[Hirasawa Yui]]'s younger sister. In stark contrast to Yui, she is far more mature and responsible, and even takes care of the irresponsible Yui. She enters Sakuragaoka Girl's High School during the latter's second year, and becomes classmates with the Light Music Club's new recruit, [[Nakano Azusa]]. In her third year, she forms a new band named [[Wakaba Girls (k-on!)|]] with Azusa and [[Suzuki Jun]].

title: suzuki_jun
body:
Jun is a character from [[K-On!]]

She shows up in Volume 1 Ch 13 of the manga; her hairstyle consist of two [[short twintails]]. She is a classmate with [[Hirasawa Ui]] and [[Nakano Azusa]], and often hangs out with them. Ui tried to get her to join the light music club but ultimately failed due to a strange visit to the club room. However, she starts to regret it when she hears about all the activities the club does. She also has a pet cat. In her third year, she forms a new band named [[Wakaba Girls (k-on!)|]] with Azusa and Ui.

title: nakano_azusa
body:
A main character of [[K-On!]]. She is often referred to as "Azu-nyan" by her mates.

The youngest and newest member of the Light Music Club, joining in her freshman year (with her other bandmates already in their second year). Like bandmate [[Hirasawa Yui]], Azusa is also a [[guitar]]ist, but with years of experience at hand compared to the former, [[playing instrument|playing]] a [[Fender Mustang]]. While trying to act as the straight girl of the band who often finds herself bewildered by her bandmates' lax habits, she also has a weakness for [[cake]]s and is rather easily placated, often by being [[headpat|petted]]. In her third year, she forms a new band named [[wakaba girls (k-on!)|Wakaba Girls]] with [[Hirasawa Ui]] and [[Suzuki Jun]].

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] stylized in [[twintails]] with [[bangs]], [[hair between eyes]], and [[sidelocks]]. Usually depicted wearing the [[Sakuragaoka High School Uniform]] with [[black socks]].

Height: 150 cm
Weight: 46 Kg
BMI: 20.44
Blood type: AB
Image colour: Purple-blue (2nd series) → Pink (3rd series onwards), Green (anime)

title: tate_no_yuusha_no_nariagari
body:
[b]Tate no Yuusha no Nariagari[/b] (transl. [i]The Rising of the Shield Hero[/i]) is a 2013 to present isekai light novel series by Yusagi Aneko that was originally published as a web novel series. The series has a 2014 to present manga adaptation and a winter 2019 anime.

The series follows the twenty-year-old college student [[Iwatani Naofumi]] who was summoned to a fantasy world along with three other young men in their teens to early twenties. The four were summoned as heroes to save the country from periodic mass appearances of monsters, an event they refer to as a "wave." Each was equipped with one of four legendary weapons: Sword, Bow, Spear, and Shield.

From the onset Naofumi as the Hero of the Shield is treated differently from the other three, with people treating him coldly, spreading rumors about him, and refusing to group with him. His situation greatly worsens and he is shunned by nearly everyone when the only person who choose to group with him falsely accuses him of raping her. Outcasted, but unable to escape his situation, he eventually is convinced to purchase a slave to make up for his lack of offensive ability. Lacking proper funds he purchases a young demi-human girl named [[Raphtalia]]. Together, Naofumi desperately tries to improve his combat ability in preparation for the next impending wave of monsters.

h4. Characters

h6. Main

* [[Iwatani Naofumi]]
* [[Raphtalia]]
* [[Filo (tate no yuusha no nariagari)|]]

h6. Others

* [[Eclair Seaetto]]
* [[Malty S Melromarc]]
* [[Rishia Ivyred]]
* [[Sadina (tate_no_yuusha_no_nariagari)|]]
* [[Atla Fayon]]

h4. External Links
* "The Rising of the Shield Hero Wiki":https://shield-hero.fandom.com
* "Wikipedia: The Rising of the Shield Hero":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rising_of_the_Shield_Hero

title: kenmochi_touya_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Kenmochi Touya]]. 

His default costume is a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[blazer]], [[grey sweater]], [[white shirt]], red [[necktie]], [[black pants]], and [[loafers]]. He is also featured with a [[bandaged arm]] and a [[shoulder strap]] that holds his kendo gear. In December 2021, he received a "short-sleeved":[https://twitter.com/rei_Toya_rei/status/1467172929461166080] version which removes his blazer and swaps his shirt with a [[t-shirt]] and his sweater with a [[grey sweater vest]]. 

For his female guise as [[Kenmochi Touko]], the difference involves replacing the black pants with a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]] and [[black pantyhose]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #3547321

title: kenmochi_touko
body:
The [[genderswap (mtf)|female genderbent]] version of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Kenmochi Touya]].

Touko was "first designed":[https://www.youtube.com/live/O_LgLHpblKE?feature=share&t=3773] by [[Morinaka Kazaki]]. Touko had her "first stream":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n3Pu1314ZF4] on April Fool's. She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[medium breasts]], and wears [[pantyhose]], but otherwise has the same attributes as Touya, commonly portrayed wearing [[Kenmochi Touya (1st costume)|the same]] default [[school uniform]] outfit. [[Shigure Ui]] would later draw a [[Kenmochi Touko (young)|loli version]] of Touko as payback for having to stream as a loli as punishment for losing a bet against Touya.

title: sumitani_yumi
body:
Sumitani Yumi (澄谷 夕美) is a Taimanin and secret idol called "YUMI-SONA". Designed by [[Kagami Hirotaka]]. Introduced in [[Taimanin RPGX]] on 30 August 2024.

A shy girl who normally does not stand out too much, typically a bookworm type and loner. She often calls herself "pile bug, slug" or other such terms when comparing herself to others that she views as better. Lacking confidence for most of her life, even though she belongs to a prestigious clan, she has only recently begun to work on herself more, but is not yet willing to share it with everyone.

Yomi awakened to her Ninja Art after a conversation, which allowed her to break out of her shell and take on different personality types, preferring the very outgoing one. She wishes to grow more confident with that but keeps this ability and second life she made as an idol a secret.

When using her Ninja Art, she changes herself to a more outgoing and flashy personality.

h4.External links
* "Taimanin Wiki: Sumitani Yumi":https://taimanin.fandom.com/wiki/Sumitani_Yumi
* "Default ver.":https://taimanin-rpg.wikiru.jp/?cmd=read&page=SR%2F%E6%BE%84%E8%B0%B7%E5%A4%95%E7%BE%8E&word=%E6%BE%84%E8%B0%B7%E5%A4%95%E7%BE%8E

title: stahlhelm
body:
The [i]Stahlhelm[/i] (lit. "steel [[helmet]]") was a [[combat helmet]] used by Germany during [[World War I]] and [[World War II]]. It replaced the [[Pickelhaube]] used during [[World War I]].

Other countries have used Stahlhelme at one time or another, including the Argentine Army, the Chinese Nationalist Army, Hungary, Ireland until 1940, Spain, Switzerland, and the Yugoslav People's Army until 1959. The helmets are also used by the Bolivian Army, the Chilean Army (in ceremonial services), and other militaries in some countries.

The shape of American [[PASGT helmet]] bears slight resemblance to the Stahlhelm. 
* !post #4057721

h4. See also
* [[Stahlhelm M1956]] - The different [[East Germany|East German]] evolution of the original design.
* [[Protect Gear]] - Power armor from [[oshii mamoru|Mamoru Oshii's]] [[Kerberos Saga]] that uses a Stahlhelme as its headgear.
* [[Tag Group:Headwear]]

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Stahlhelm":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stahlhelm]

title: killdozer
body:
The "Killdozer" incident occurred on June 4, 2004, in Granby, Colorado, when Marvin Heemeyer, frustrated by local government decisions affecting his business, armored a bulldozer and went on a destructive rampage. Heemeyer's modified bulldozer, nicknamed "Killdozer," demolished 13 buildings, including the town hall and a former mayor's house, causing over $5 million in damages.

The rampage lasted about 90 minutes, and while no one else was harmed, Heemeyer took his own life when the bulldozer got stuck. This incident has since become a controversial and somewhat legendary story, with some viewing Heemeyer as a folk hero standing up against perceived injustices.

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Marvin Heemeyer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvin_Heemeyer]

title: strapless_bra
body:
A [[bra]] without straps, relying on an extra-wide band for breast support. 

They are designed to be worn with [[strapless]] clothing that would otherwise expose the bra straps. They achieve their strength through a longer underwire that encompasses more of the breast, and cups with added padding, boning, and shaping panels. Some have rubberized or silicone beading inside the top edge of the cup to help keep the bra attached to the breast. Some convertible bras allow the straps to be removed, making them into strapless bras.

Don't confuse [[strapless bra]]s with [[tube top]]s or [[bandeau]]s. A strapless bra has cups, while tube tops and bandeaus don't.

h4. See also

* [[adhesive bra]]
* [[bandeau]]
* [[belt bra]]
* [[tube top]]
* [[sarashi]]
* [[strapless Bikini]]
* [[Tag Group:Bra]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: hennin
body:
A tall [[headdress]] worn by women of nobility in the Late Middle Ages of Europe; typically conical. Long strips of silk or gauze are sometimes attached.

Historically, the headpiece itself could be so tall that it made the wearer stand up to 12 feet in height. 

Contrast with the [[escoffion]], which is much wider,  and sat over the wearer's head.

title: js_izumo_(ddh-183)
body:
Izumo (DDH-183) is the lead ship of the Izumo-class [[aircraft carrier]]s (officially classed as helicopter destroyers) of the [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]]. The Izumo-class are currently the largest warships of the JMSDF.

The class' official classification as a "destroyer" served as a loophole around the post-World War II Japanese constitution that prohibits the construction of "offensive weapons".

h4. See also
* [[JS Kaga (DDH-184)]] - sister ship

title: js_kaga_(ddh-184)
body:
The second ship of the Izumo-class "helicopter carrier destroyers" (DDH-184) that was launched on 27 August 2015 and later "converted" into an [[aircraft carrier]]. Also the first ship to bear the Kaga name since the Tosa-class battleship turned aircraft carrier from World War II.

Consequently, she has appeared in art featuring her [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i] [[Kaga (Kancolle)|version]], including in "official art":[https://twitter.com/ko131415/status/1064360710514237441?s=21] shown on an on-deck poster.

title: jerry_can
body:
A robust rectangular [[container]] for fluids such as [[fuel]] and [[water]]. The name refers to its German origins, from the wartime slang "Jerry" for Germans. Recognizable by the cross-shaped indentations on the sides, which improve structural integrity and allow greater surface area for thermal expansion.

The original German design had a 20 liter (approx. 5 gal) capacity and was made from pressed steel. Modern versions are also made in plastic. To prevent contamination (mixing different fuels or mixing fuel with water), color coding or imprinted labels are sometimes used.

Apply this tag only to containers of comparable size and capacity, and bearing the characteristic indentations on the sides. For other (e.g. smaller) containers for gasoline, try [[gas can]].

* !post #458040

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia - Jerrycan":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerrycan
* "Wikipeida (Japanese) - Jerrycan":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%B8%E3%82%A7%E3%83%AA%E3%82%AB%E3%83%B3]

title: m113
body:
A fully [[caterpillar tracks|tracked]] [[armored personnel carrier]] that was developed and produced by the "FMC Corporation":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FMC_Corporation]. The M113 was sent to [[United States Army]] Europe in 1961 to replace the mechanized infantry's M59 APCs. The M113 was first used in combat in April 1962 after the United States provided the South Vietnamese Army with heavy weaponry such as the M113, under the "MACV":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_Assistance_Command,_Vietnam] program. Eventually, the M113 was the most widely used armored vehicle of the U.S. Army in the [[Vietnam War]] and was used to break through heavy thickets in the midst of the [[jungle]] to attack and overrun enemy positions. It gained the nickname as the modern "battle taxi". 

The M113 was the first aluminum hull [[military vehicle|combat vehicle]] to be put into mass production. Much lighter than earlier similar vehicles, its aluminum armor was designed to be thick enough to protect the crew and passengers against [[under fire|small arms fire]], but light enough that the vehicle was air transportable and moderately amphibious.

The APC's versatility spawned a wide variety of adaptations that live on worldwide and in U.S. service. It is estimated that over 80,000 vehicles in the M113 family have been produced and used by over 50 countries worldwide, making it one of the most widely used [[armored vehicle]]s of all time. The production was terminated in 2007.

h4. See also
* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "M113":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M113_armored_personnel_carrier]

title: ah-1_cobra
body:
An [[attack helicopter|attack]] [[helicopter]] that combined the proven twin-bladed rotor, engine, and drive train of Bell's [[UH-1 Iroquois]] with a new slimline fuselage. It came in two main variants, the single-engine HueyCobra and the twin-engined SeaCobra (and later SuperCobra), the latter having a wider engine compartment. The AH-1 had a crew of two in tandem, with the gunner seated in front and pilot in the back. 

Fixed armament included a chin-mounted turret armed with either [[machine gun|machine guns]], grenade projectors, or a single 20mm multibarrel [[cannon]]. Stub wings on either side of the fuselage could carry additional armament, such as [[rocket|rockets]] and TOW anti-tank [[missile|missiles]].

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Bell AH-1":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AH-1
* Youtube: "Cobra Attack Helicopter":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UvFeyslhWRo

title: mi-28
body:
Two-seat all-weather [[attack helicopter|attack]] [[helicopter]] made in the 1980s by the Mil helicopter company. It seats two crew in heavily-armored tandem cockpits, and can carry up to three passengers in a small cabin. 

The Mi-28's fixed armament consists of a 30mm [[cannon]] in a dual-feed undernose barbette. It can carry a mix of antiair or ground-attack missiles, rockets, gun pods, and dispensers under its stub wings. A thimble radome on the nose of the helicopter houses a laser rangefinder and radar that provides ranging and weapon guidance; the Mi-28N variant augments this with a mast-mounted radar and a chin-mounted FLIR/TV turret.

h4. See also

* [[AH-64 Apache]]
* [[Mi-24]]

title: mi-24
body:
[[Attack helicopter|Attack]] [[helicopter]] built by Mil Moscow Helicoptor Plant also known by the NATO reporting name [b]Hind[/b]. Carries a crew of two or three, plus up to eight troops in a small cabin. Early versions had a boxy, flat-paned nose section; later ones have two bubble canopies. The Mi-24 has a five-bladed main rotor and a tail rotor mounted high on the vertical fin. Stub wings with considerable "anhedral":http://www.skyhighhobby.com/tag/anhedral let it carry various munitions such as [[rocket|rockets]], podded [[cannon]], antitank missiles, and bombs. 

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Mil Mi-24":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mil_Mi-24

title: ah-64_apache
body:
[[attack helicopter|Assault]] [[helicopter]] in use by United States Army Aviation, the IDF and the JSDF, among others. Produced by Boeing. Recognition features include TADS/PNVS sensor assembly on nose, conventional wheeled landing gear, main-tail rotor configuration with four-bladed main rotor with swept tips. All-moving tailplane at end of low-mounted boom, along with a port-facing tail rotor with blades lying at angles of 60 and 120 degrees to each other. Engine pods on either side of the main fuselage. Crew of gunner and pilot under single canopy separated by bullet-resistant polycarbonate pane. Faired section at bottom of fuselage houses electronics.

Fixed armament of one 30mm M230 Chain Gun in underfuselage turret. The Apache's stub wings can carry various types of ordnance, including multiple-tube rocket pods, anti-tank missiles, and short-range air-to-air missiles.

The AH-64D Apache Longbow variant has a flat radar dish mounted on top of the rotor mast.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_AH-64_Apache

title: btr-80
body:
[b]Брони́рованный транспортёр — 80 моде́ль[/b] (literally "Armoured Transporter - Model 80")

A 8×8 wheeled amphibious [[armored personnel carrier]] (APC) designed in the [[soviet|USSR]]. It was adopted in 1985 and replaced the previous vehicles, BTR-60 and BTR-70, in the [[Soviet Army]]. It was first deployed during the [[war in afghanistan|Soviet–Afghan War]]. The APC was introduced into service in 1986.

The BTR-80 was developed into the larger [[BTR-90]].

title: dullahan
body:
A character with a removable head.

In Irish folklore, the Dullahan is a [[headless]] rider or a beheaded knight who carries his [[severed head]] under one arm while viciously attacking interlopers in the place that is haunted by the dullahan. They also have some magic in their bodies, giving them magical swords or the ability to breathe fire from the severed head.

In anime and videogames, the Dullahan is sometimes portrayed as an animated suit of [[armor]]. Examples include [[Dullahan (golden sun)|]] from [[Golden Sun]], an optional final boss character, or the [[Durahan]] species of monster in [[Monster Farm]].

h4. Notable Dullahans

* [[Celty Sturluson]] from [i][[Durarara!!]][/i]

title: hida_ema
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Former tank commander of a [[Maus (tank)|]], and current tank commander of a [[Panzer IV]], on the "Kuromorimine":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.

Voiced by [[Moriya Satomi]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

Initially an unnamed mob character with the nickname Mauko ([tn]Mau=Maus, Ko=Girl[/tn]) due to her being the tank commander of the Maus, she was eventually given the official name Hida Ema.

[expand=Official Character Bio]
h5. Kuromorimine Girls Academy

h6. Das Finale

Tank Commander of a Panzer IV, and former commander of the Maus. She used to believe that "power is justice", but since her Maus was defeated so easily in the battle with Ooarai, the shock lingered in her mind for quite a while. After that, she changed her beliefs to "mobility is justice". She says she's completely over it, but she still dreams of the time that she was blown away.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]
[/expand]

title: reliant_robin
body:
A small [[autocycle]] produced by the British company Reliant from the 1970s until the 1990s. 

The tricycle infamously had a tendency to roll over due to it having very light and unstable chassis (being mostly made out of plastics). Because of its very light weight and the British law at that time only considered vehicle with four or more wheels as a "car", it was marketed as an "enclosed three-wheeled motorcycle", and only required a motorcycle license, unlike other cars such as the Mini.

Due to the vehicle's notoriously poor build and cheap costs, it was subjected to various butt of jokes in British media, such as in [[mr. bean (series)|Mr. Bean]] and [[Top Gear]].
other_names: リライアント・ロビン

title: vespa_150_tap
body: A [[Vespa]] [[scooter]] modified by the [[French Army]] in 1956 as a cheap, air-dropable anti-tank vehicle for paratrooper's use. The vehicle is equipped with a 75 mm recoiless rifle, though due to the bike's flimsy body and the lack of aiming device, it is not intended to be shot while mounted on the vehicle.

title: matsukaze_rin
body:
Rin Matsukaze is a main character from the [[Girls und Panzer]] spinoff, [[Girls und Panzer Ribbon no Musha|Girls und Panzer: Ribbon no Musha]]. 

[[Tsuruki Shizuka]], Rin, and [[Endou Haruka]] are students at Tatenashi High School. They represent the school in Tankathlon (a cousin of Tankery) under the banner of Team Centipede. Rin serves as both mechanic and driver of the team's sole vehicle, a red [[Type 97 Te-Ke|Type 97 Te-Ke tankette]].

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], tousled [[blonde hair]] that springs little [[hair flaps]] near her temples. Most of the time, Rin wears a plain [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]], the school's [[plaid skirt]], and a [[blue sweater|blue]] [[sweater]] [[sweater around waist|tied around her waist]].

Voiced by [[Tanaka Aimi]] in the mobile game [[Girls und Panzer senshadou daisakusen!]].

title: sonna_no_kankei_nee_(meme)
body:
This meme refers to a comedy routine by [[Kojima Yoshio]] that became popular around 2008.

It consists of Kojima (a thin but muscular man) wearing nothing but [[swim briefs]] (and sometimes a [[baseball cap]]), holding a [[microphone]] and telling short jokes on top of a music track punctuated by the phrase "sonna no kankei nee" (meaning "but that's unrelated") while [[squatting|crouching]] and [[fist pump]]ing towards the ground, and ending with the phrase "hai oppappi!" (a seemingly meaningless catch phrase that the comedian states to mean "Yeah, Ocean Pacific Peace") while [[standing on one leg]] with [[arm_up|one arm raised]].

A video of an example of the routine "can be seen here":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BDRsFhffHD0].

h4. External links
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia - Sonna no kankei nee":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%81%9D%E3%82%93%E3%81%AA%E3%81%AE%E9%96%A2%E4%BF%82%E3%81%AD%E3%81%87]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia - Oppappi":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%AA%E3%83%83%E3%83%91%E3%83%83%E3%83%94%E3%83%BC]
* "The Rising Sky - Kojima Yoshio’s Sonna no Kankei nee ~ Oppappi":[https://therisingsky.wordpress.com/2012/07/27/kojima-yoshios-%E3%81%9D%E3%82%93%E3%81%AA%E3%81%AE%E9%96%A2%E4%BF%82%E3%81%AD%E3%81%87%EF%BD%9E%E3%81%8A%E3%81%A3%E3%81%B1%E3%81%A3%E3%81%B4/] - an English blog post explaining the meme

[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [i]HMS Unicorn[/i] (I72), a light aircraft carrier and aircraft repair ship. Character design by [[Kaede (Yumesaki Kaede)|]], voiced by [[Kakuma Ai]].

She is portrayed as a shy [[petite]] [[oppai_loli|big breasted girl]] with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. In her default outfit she wears a [[white dress]] and carries a [[stuffed winged unicorn]] she names "Yuni". Most notably, she sees the [[Commander (azur lane)|]] as a big brother. 

Often portrayed alongside [[Illustrious (Azur lane)|]] as both were historically built at Harland and Wolff's Belfast shipyard.

body:
[[Bleach]] character.

Gremmy is a [[Quincy (bleach)|]] and a member of the [[Wandenreich]]. He is the [[Sternritter]] "V" of "the Visionary" and has the power to change or create things by imagining them.

He is a slender boy with [[messy_hair|messy]] [[blonde_hair|blond hair]] and [[red eyes]]. He wears a variation of the [[Wandenreich uniform]] consisting of a long white [[trench coat]], white [[pants]], black [[sneakers]] and a white [[hood]].

[spoilers]His body is actually a product of his power; his true form is only a brain in a jar.[/spoilers]

title: blake_belladonna
body:
Blake Belladonna is one of the main characters of [[RWBY]], a 3DCG series produced by Rooster Teeth. 

Blake is the "B" in RWBY, and is associated with the color black. Her character design is inspired by both of the eponymous characters in the fairy tale [[Beauty and the Beast]].
Blake is somewhat aloof, enjoys reading, and seems to have a checkered past. 

h4. Abilities 
She wields a [[katana]]/[[cleaver]]/[[handgun]]/[[kama_(weapon)|kama]] hybrid weapon named [[Gambol Shroud]] (officially classified as a "Variant Ballistic Chain Scythe"). Using the [[ribbon]] around her arm as a chain, it resembles a [[kusarigama]]. Her symbol is a belladonna (aka deadly nightshade) [[flower]]. Her semblance (special ability) produces shadow clones. 

h4. Physical characteristics 
Blake has [[yellow eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]]. 

[spoiler]Her bow hides a pair of [[cat ears]].[/spoiler]

She stands 5' 6" tall (including high heels).

h4. Attire 
Blake tends to wear black and white clothing. She usually has a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]] on top of her head. Her default outfit includes a small [[black scarf]] around her neck, a black [[vest]] with long [[coattails]] on top of a white [[sleeveless shirt]] that leaves her [[bare shoulders|shoulders]] and [[midriff]] bare, a black [[single_detached_sleeve|detached sleeve]] on her left arm, black [[arm ribbon]]s wrapped around both forearms, [[white_shorts|white]] [[shorts]] (sometimes depicted with [[garter straps]]) [[pantyhose under shorts|over]] [[black pantyhose]] (with her belladonna symbol printed on), and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. 

Her Beacon [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]] with [[neck ribbon]], brown [[blazer]], and [[plaid skirt]]. She retains her black hair bow. 

h4. External links

* "RWBY Wikia: Blake Belladonna":https://rwby.wikia.com/wiki/Blake_Belladonna
other_names: ブレイク・ベラドンナ

title: weiss_schnee
body:
Weiss Schnee is one of the main characters of [[RWBY]], a 3DCG series produced by Rooster Teeth. 

Weiss is the "W" in RWBY, and is associated with the color white. Her character design is inspired by [[Snow White (grimm)|]].
[[Winter Schnee]] is her sister. As heiress to the Schnee Dust Company, her life has been marked by pressure. Her arrogant and prickly exterior hides a softer heart. 

h4. Abilities 
She wields a sword/revolver hybrid weapon named [[Myrtenaster]], a "Multi-Action Dust [[Rapier]]" (MADR). Her symbol is a snowflake, and [[magic circle|magic circles]] ("glyphs") appear when she uses her semblance (special ability).  

h4. Physical characteristics 
Weiss has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]] off to one [[side_ponytail|side]]. She has a [[scar]] [[scar_across_eye|over]] her left eye.  

She stands 5' 3" tall (including [[high heels]]). 

h4. Attire

She usually wears a [[tiara]] in her hair, around her ponytail, and often wears a bit of jewelry: [[earrings]] and a [[necklace]] with [[pendant]]. Her default outfit includes a white [[cropped jacket]] with a [[high collar]] (revealing the red interior lining) and [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves]], a blueish-[[white dress|white]] [[strapless dress]] with [[lace-trimmed skirt]] over a [[petticoat]], and blueish-[[white footwear|white]] [[boots]] with [[high heel boots|high heels]]. Her [[belt]] is a [[ribbon]] tied with a [[bow]] in front, holding a [[belt pouch]] with Dust supplies on her back.  

Her Beacon [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]] with [[neck ribbon]], brown [[blazer]], and [[plaid skirt]].  

h4. External links

* "RWBY Wikia: Weiss Schnee":https://rwby.wikia.com/wiki/Weiss_Schnee

title: yang_xiao_long
body:
One of the main characters of [[RWBY]]. Yang is the "Y" in RWBY, and is associated with the color yellow. Her character design is inspired by [[Goldilocks (grimm)|]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]] with an [[ahoge]], and has fairly [[large breasts]]. 

She wields a pair of [[shotgun]]/gauntlet (technically [[vambraces]]) hybrid weapons named [[ember_celica_(rwby)|Ember Celica]], classified as "Dual Ranged Shot Gauntlets" (DRSG). Her weapons eject [[shell_casing|shell casings]]. Her symbol is a burning heart. Her eyes turn [[red eyes|red]] and [[fire]] surrounds her when her semblance (special ability) activates, which converts the damage she takes into additional strength. 

Yang tends to wear yellow/orange/brown/black clothing. Her default outfit includes a long [[orange scarf]] wrapped around her neck, a [[midriff]]-baring [[brown jacket]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] over a [[cleavage]]-revealing [[yellow shirt|yellow]] [[tube top]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] underneath her weapon Ember Celica, a brown [[belt]] with [[buckle]] that secures a short [[waist cape]] over [[black shorts|black]] [[shorts]], an [[uneven legwear|asymmetrical]] pair of [[kneehighs|kneehigh]] and [[over-kneehighs|over-kneehigh]] socks, and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[knee boots]]. 

Her Beacon [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]] with [[neck ribbon]], brown [[blazer]], and [[plaid skirt]]. 

[[Ruby Rose]] is her half-sister. She loves her family, her hair, her [[motorcycle]], and fights. Guilty of bad puns. 

[spoiler]At the end of Season 3 of RWBY, Yang has her right arm severed at the elbow by [[Adam Taurus]], and in Season 4 receives a [[prosthetic_arm|prosthetic replacement]].[/spoiler]

h4. External links

* "RWBY Wiki: Yang Xiao Long":https://rwby.wikia.com/wiki/Yang_Xiao_Long

title: goldilocks_(grimm)

title: ruby_rose
body:
Ruby Rose is the protagonist of [[RWBY]], a 3DCG series produced by Rooster Teeth. 

Ruby is the "R" in RWBY, and is associated with the color red. Her character design is inspired by [[Little Red Riding Hood (grimm)|]]. [[Yang Xiao Long]] is her half-sister. She likes cookies, drinks milk, and has a cheerful disposition.

h4. Abilities 

She wields a large [[scythe]]/[[gun]] hybrid weapon named [[Crescent Rose]], a "High-Caliber Sniper-Scythe" (HCSS). Her symbol is a [[rose]], and red [[rose petals]] appear when she uses her speed semblance (special ability).  

When in the presence of [[grimm (rwby)|]], her eyes are able to glow brightly with a silvery light. When this ability is used, any [[grimm (rwby)|]] in front of this light will be turned to dust or petrified, depending on how large the grimm is; very strong ones may be able to partially resist the effect.

h4. Physical characteristics 

Ruby has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[two-tone hair|two-toned]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[red hair]]/[[black hair]], or black with red streaks. 

In earlier volumes of the series, she stood 5'2" tall (including boots). As of Volume 7, she is 5'4" tall.

h4. Attire 

She is usually seen in a [[red cape|red]] [[cape]] or [[hooded cloak]] secured with [[cross]]-shaped pins. Her default outfit includes a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[black dress]] (with red [[frilled dress|frills]]) tied with a [[corset]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]] with red [[lace-up boots|laces]]. Her [[belt]] is a [[bandolier]] with large [[bullet]] [[cartridge|cartridges]].  Most of her oufits include a [[rose]]-shaped badge somewhere on them.

Her Beacon [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]] with [[neck ribbon]], brown [[blazer]], and [[plaid skirt]], plus her customary red cape.  

h4. External links

* "RWBY Wikia: Ruby Rose":https://rwby.wikia.com/wiki/Ruby_Rose

title: shockwave_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Shockwave[/b] is an evil [[Decepticon]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a purple [[cybertron]]ian [[energy gun]].

He is equipped with a powerful [[arm cannon]]. Shockwave is also one of the few Transformers without a face, having only a yellow sensor "eye" in his head.

In [[Japan]] his name was changed to [b]Laserwave[/b] (レーザーウェーブ).

[quote]Motto: [i]"Clarity of thought before rashness of action...".[/i][/quote]

h4.See also

title: sentient_stuffed_toy
body:
Depictions of [[stuffed toy]]s that are otherwise not stagnant, making them appear 'alive'; example scenarios include toy that can walk or fly on their own, and toys that are responsive to the world around them. 

The toys may be moving either of their own volition, or due to another mechanism, such as with wind-up toys.

* For depictions of sexual acts with stuffed toys (plushophilia), see [[teddy bear sex]]. 

* Not to be confused with [[animal costume]]s, [[mascot costume]]s or [[furry|furries]].
