title: jenet_behrn
body:
[[Fatal Fury]] character, also known as [b]B. Jenet[/b] for short.

She made her debut in [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]] as a newcomer, makes a returning appearance in [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], and made several appearances in [[The King of Fighters]] series.

She is an English pirate with [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], wearing a purple halterneck with a white [[Jolly Roger]] on the leg of the dress. She wears purple [[high heels]] to go with her dress and a [[thong]] underneath. 

Her real name is Jenet Behrn (ジェニー・バーン), and she is the leader of the Lillien Knights, a pirate crew that travels the world. Jenet led a life of luxury before leaving to become a pirate.

She fights using a [[martial arts]] style she calls LK Arts (Lillien Knight Arts), which is a combination of various martial arts and primarily based on savate (French kickboxing).

h4. External links

* "SNK Wiki: B. Jenet":[https://snk.fandom.com/wiki/B._Jenet]

title: cyrillic
body:
Images featuring the [b]Cyrillic[/b] script, an alphabet most commonly used by Slavic languages, such as [[russian text|Russian]], but also by various Turkic and Iranic languages spoken in post-Soviet Central Asia. It bears some superficial resemblance to the Latin alphabet, as they share a common ancestor with Greek, but is distinguishable from the Latin alphabet by a number of unique characters.

title: zoom_layer
body:
An additional layer that magnifies part of the illustration. It's a common technique used for backgrounds in character art. 

There are sometimes small, primarily 2D variations, such as:

* The layer being reversed.
* The layer being rotated.
* The layer being partially transparent, in greyscale, or having other changes in color.
* A character having a different expression.

If the layer is from a different 3D perspective, or there are larger 3D differences such as costumes, poses, or characters, it's a [[projected inset]] instead.

For the "zoom layer" effect used on [[stage]]s by projecting the performance on background [[screen]]s, use [[screen zoom]] instead.

h4. See also
* [[Character Background]]
* [[Tag group:Backgrounds]]
* [[Tag group:Image composition]]

title: pj_bass
body:
PJ (Precision/Jazz) bass is a generic term for any bass guitar that has [[fender_precision_bass|precision]]-style pickups in the neck position and a [[fender_jazz_bass|jazz]]-style pickup in the bridge position. 
Precision-style pickups are recognizable by the fact that they consist of two offset rectangular blocks stacked on top of one another, while jazz-style pickups usually look like a single bar.

title: bass_guitar
body:
A plucked string [[instrument]], closely related to the [[guitar]]. See [[double bass]] for the traditional bowed string instrument.

A bass guitar can be distinguished from a standard guitar by the fact that it almost always has [b]four strings[/b], and four tuning pegs at the top of the neck, usually along one side or with two on each side directly opposed. The bridge is also much closer to the bottom of the body to accommodate the longer strings.

Do not tag [[bass guitar]]s as regular [[guitar]]s.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: bachi

title: project_ultraman
body:
An unreleased concept for the [[Ultra Series]]. Produced by Chaiyo Productions, instead of [[Tsuburaya Productions]].

It was intended to be released in 2006, but the project was scrapped, due to a court battle between Tsuburaya and Chaiyo occurring around the same time.

title: dark_ultraman
body:
A character from [[Project Ultraman]], an unauthorized concept from the [[Ultra Series]].

He is described to be a once heroic Ultraman, named; Ultraman Zoul, but he then turned evil, predating [[Ultraman Belial]].

Along the way, he would learn about Project Ultraman in the highly-guarded BASE 64, and through his encounters with Millennium, he would eventually have a change of heart that would have resulted in him siding with them (alongside Ultraman Elite) to stop S' plans from coming to fruition.
other_names: ダーク・ウルトラマン

title: gimai_seikatsu
body:
An ongoing light novel series written by Mikawa Ghost and illustrated by [[Hiten (hitenkei)|]]. It began publishing in January 2021. The series follows [[Asamura Yuuta]] and his now step-sister, [[Ayase Saki]] who's not only his classmate but also considered the most popular and beautiful girl in school. There is a manga adaptation that began publishing in July 2021 with illustrations by [[Yumika (mono zone)|]]. There is a Summer 2024 anime adaptation by [[Studio Deen]].

title: tetrapod
body:
A concrete [[wave breaker]], shaped like a huge caltrop or jack. The edges are typically rounded, but don't have to be. They're placed in large numbers at the edges of [[harbor|harbors]] or [[beach|beaches]], acting as a reef.

title: aztec
body:
A group of ancient cultures located in modern day [[Mexico]]. Often the term "Aztec" refers exclusively to the Mexica people of [[Tenochtitlan]] (now the location of [[Mexico City]]), situated on an island in Lake Texcoco, who referred to themselves as Mexica Tenochca.

The [b]Aztec[/b] people were certain ethnic groups of central Mexico, particularly those groups who spoke the Nahuatl language and who dominated large parts of Mesoamerica in the 14th, 15th and 16th centuries, a period referred to as the late post-classic period in Mesoamerican chronology.

In 1521, in what is probably the most widely known episode in the Spanish colonization of the Americas (also known as "La Conquista"), [[Hernan Cortes]], along with a large number of Nahuatl speaking indigenous allies, conquered [[Tenochtitlan]] and defeated the Aztec Triple Alliance under the leadership of Hueyi Tlatoani [[Moctezuma II]]; In the series of events often referred to as "The Fall of the Aztec Empire". 

Subsequently the Spanish founded the new settlement of Mexico City on the site of the ruined Aztec capital.

title: hauchiwa
body:
A magical [[hand fan]] made of feathers, commonly possessed by [[Tengu]]. Hauchiwa may resemble a maple leaf, but they are not actually made of leaves.

In folk tales, these fans sometimes have the ability to grow or shrink a person's nose, but usually they are attributed the power to stir up great winds.

[[Shameimaru Aya]] from [[Touhou]] is one of the more notable hauchiwa-possessing characters, and is frequently depicted with one. While hauchiwa typically have a vaguely leaf-like appearance anyway, Aya's resembles a [[maple leaf]] (down to its coloring and use of fewer feathers in order to specifically achieve a leaf-like shape).

Do not tag hauchiwa with [[leaf fan]], as the former is not made out of leaves, despite some hauchiwa having superficially similar appearance to a maple leaf.

Some Tengu characters may carry an actual [[leaf fan]] instead of a hauchiwa, e.g. [[Kurama (urusei_yatsura)|]] from [[Urusei Yatsura]]. Tag these examples as [[leaf fan]] instead of [[hauchiwa]], as they are not made out of feathers.

title: charm_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Charm[/b] (オマツ, Omatsu) is a character in [i][[Pokemon Legends: Arceus|Pokémon Legends Arceus]][/i]. She is the leader of the Miss Fortunes and hates the Galaxy Expedition Team.

[spoiler]Charm is a former member of the Galaxy Expedition Team and came from Kanto.[/spoiler]

Charm has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]], [[grey eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her [[makeup]] includes [[purple lips|purple lipstick]] and [[red eyeshadow]]. She wears a [[sarashi]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[purple jacket]], a [[purple kimono|purple]] and [[black kimono|black]] [[short kimono]], a [[black belt]], [[purple pantyhose]], [[grey leg warmers]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[sandals]].

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Charm (Hisui)":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Charm_(Hisui)]

title: clover_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Clover[/b] (オタケ, Otake) is a character in [i][[Pokemon Legends: Arceus|Pokémon Legends Arceus]][/i]. She is the youngest of the Miss Fortunes.

[spoiler]Clover is a former member of both the Diamond Clan and the Galaxy Expedition Team.[/spoiler]

Clover has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied in [[twintails]], [[brown eyes]], and [[small breasts]] or [[flat chest]]. Her [[makeup]] includes [[red eyeshadow|red]] and [[blue eyeshadow]]. She wears rounded [[triangle earrings]], a [[sarashi]], an [[open jacket|open]] and [[torn jacket|torn]] [[blue jacket]] and a [[torn skirt|torn]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], both resembling the [[Ginkgo Guild uniform]], a [[brown belt]], [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts under skirt|bike shorts under her skirt]], and [[black footwear|black]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[boots]] from the [[Diamond Clan outfit]]. She also carries small bags similar to carried by the Ginkgo Guild.

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Clover":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Clover]

title: burrito
body:
An [[antojito]] dish in [[Mexico|Mexican]] and Tex-Mex cuisine that consists of a flour [[tortilla]] wrapped in a sealed cylindrical shape around various ingredients.

Described by most Mexicans as basically a giant [[taco]]. The word burrito literally means "little [[donkey]]" in [[spanish_text|Spanish]].

title: taco
body:
A popular and traditional [[mexico|Mexican]] [[antojito]] dish composed of a corn or wheat tortilla folded or rolled around a filling. A taco can be made with a variety of fillings, including beef, mutton, shellfish, vegetables and cheese, allowing for great versatility and variety.

title: gamecenter_cx
body:
A long-running program on [[Fuji Television]], starring Yoiko member [[Arino Shin'ya]] as the section chief of fictional company Game Center CX. 

While the earliest seasons focused on Arino interviewing different game companies and learning about the backgrounds of their various works, this was later dropped. The series is well known for its "Arino's Challenge" (有野の挑戦状, [i]Arino no Chousenjou[/i]) segments, where Arino plays through and attempts to complete retro games with the help of his Assistant Directors and various other staff members. It was briefly brought over to the West in the late 2000's as [i]Retro Game Master[/i]. [[Nintendo]] eventually released a parody of the series in 2015 on its Youtube page titled [i]Gamecenter DX[/i], which has Arino's co-star Hamaguchi Masaru as a manager playing games that haven't been released.

In 2007, the series had a [[Nintendo DS]] game modeled after it: [i][[Gamecenter CX: Arino's Challenge]][/i], with a lot of the game's input coming directly from the show's staff. The game then got a sequel in 2009 and a [[Nintendo 3DS]] sequel in 2014.
